I have included an entire song albeit asked to put lines because I felt every line of this song is worth it. One of the songs with the best lyrics has to be Aisa desh hai mera from the movie VeerZaara. For those who don't know, this song is the way an Indian boy tries to portray India's beauty to a Pakistani girl in the movie.  kinna sona des hai mera...	[How beautiful is my country...]dhartii sunaharii ambar niila [Golden earth and blue sky]dhartii sunaharii ambar niilahar mausam rangiila[Golden earth and blue sky, every season is brilliantly colored]aisa des hai mera ho aisa des hai mera...	[that's the way my country is...]bole papiiha koyal gaa'e	[The cuckoos sing;]bole papiiha koyal gaa'e saawan girke aa'e	[the cuckoos cry out and the rain pours down]aisa des hai mera ho aisa des hai mera...	[That's the way my country is]Ghehoon me khethon kangi Jo kare hawaiyen[Where the breeze combs through the fields of wheat,]Rang birangii kitnii chunariyaan ud ud jaa'en	[a rainbow of scarves go flying.]panghat par panhaaran jab gagrii bharne aaye[While the farm girls come to fill their pots at the well,]madhur madhur taanon mein kahiin bansi koii bajaaye lo sun lo	[someone plays the flute in a sweet, soft melody: listen!]qadam qadam pe hai mil jaanii	[At every step, you will encounter...]qadam qadam pe hai mil jaanii koii prem kahaanii	[at every step, you will encounter a love story.]aisa des hai mera ho aisa des hai mera	[That's what my country is like...]baap ke kandhe charhke jahaan bachche dekhe mele	[where children watch festivals from atop their fathers' shoulders,]melon mein natak tamaashe kulfii ke chaat ke thaile	[festivals full of dance, spectacle, and delicious food.]kahiin miltii miithii golii kahiin chuuran kii hai puriyaa	[Here you might get a sweet dessert; there, a salty snack.]bhole bhole bachche hai jaise gudde aur guriyaan	[The innocent children are like dolls,]aur inko roz sunaa'en daadii-naanii [and every day, their grandmothers...]roz sunaa'e.n daadii-naanii ek pariyon kii kahaanii	[every day, their grandmothers read them fairy tales.]aisa des hai mera ho aisa des hai mera	[That's what my country is like.]mere des mein mahamaanon ko bhagwaan kahaa jaata hai	[In my country, visitors are considered gods;]ho yahiin ka ho jaata hai jo kahiin se bhii aata hai	[you're made at home no matter where you come from.]  And this is what the Pakistani girl replies. tere des ko main ne dekha tere des ko main ne jaana...	[I've seen your country; I've gotten to know it...]jaane kyon yeh lagta hai mujhko jaana pahachaana[I don't know why, but it seems so familiar to me;]yahaan kii vahii shaam hai vahii savera	[The same evening, the same sort of sunrise...]yahaan kii vahii shaam hai vahii savera aisa hii des hai mera	[Same as the evenings and the dawns in my country]jaisa des hai tera jaisa des hai tera jaisa des hai tera	[are just like those in yours.]aisa des hai mera jaisa des hai tera... [This is what my country's like, the same as yours...]aisa des hai mera	[This is what my country is like.]jaisa des hai mera	[It's just like mine.]

In the world of Hindi film music, the uncrowned king of Lyrics is Gulzar sahab. His lyrics are transcendental. The man is an enigma. A few lines which depict his genius are given below. One song that I cannot take off my mind is  Humne dekhi hai inn aakhon ki mehkti khushboo, haath se chooke ise rishton ka ilzaam na do.Sirf ehsaas hai ise rooh se mehsoos karo,pyaar ko pyaar hi rehne do koi naam na do. This is from Khamoshi written by Gulzar. Seriously!? Oh my! What spectacular lines! Gulzar's best is probably Mera Kuch Samaan. The imagery that song brings in is inexplicable. Ek sau solah chaand ki raatein ye tumhare kaandhe ka til,geeli mehendi ki khushboo, jhooth mooth ke shikwe kuch,jhooth mooth ke waade bhi sab yaad kara doon, sab bhijwado,Mera woh saman lauta do....ek ijaazat de do bas, jab isko dafnaaungi main bhi wahi so jaungi. His work in Dil Se has no words to describe. Tu hi tu satrangi re has lines that has to be heard over and over and understood to know the philosophical depth they take. The seven stages of love so beautifully crafted in a single poem! Jiya Jale is one another astounding achievement. Ang ang mein jalti hai dard ki chingaariyan,masle phoolo ke mehek mein titliyo ki kyaarian,raat bhar bechari mehendi pisti hai pairon tale,kya karoon kaise kahoon rat kab kaise dhale. Jiya jale jaan jale... Cinema music and lyrics bring just one name to the mind -Gulzar. Just listen to any of his songs. Your answer lies there.

Naina thang lenge thag lenge, naina thag lenge (3)  Naina raat ko chalte chalte swargon mein lejaven Eyes will take you to heaven at night Megh malhar ke sapne beejen, hariyali dikhlaven Show you dreams of rain filled clouds and greenery Nainon ki jubaan pe bharosa nahin aata Don't believe the word of eyes Likhat padat na raseed na khata There's no record, no receipt, no letter to attest what they promise Saari baat havayi re, saari baat havayi All their words are blown in the wind Bin badal barsaven saavan, saavan bin barsaton They can bring rain without clouds Bin badal barsaven saavan, naina baanvara kardenge .....They'll bring rain without clouds, they'll drive you mad....

Our Hindi films have so many good songs, that it is very difficult to recount them all. However let me recall a few of them--- 1. कल्पना के घन बरसते, गीत गीले हो रहे,    भाव रिमझिम कर रहे हैं, स्वर रसीले हो रहे .... (गीतकार--भरत व्यास, संगीतकार--वसंत देसाई, स्वर--लता मंगेशकर--महेन्द्र कपूर, फिल्म-अमर ज्योति ) 2. आधा है चंद्रमा, रात आधी,     रह न जाए तेरी-मेरी बात आधी,     मुलाकात आधी...... ( भरत व्यास, सी. रामचंद्र, आशा भोंसले--महेंद्र कपूर, नवरंग )  3. हो उमड़-घुमड़ कर आयी रे घटा      कारी-कारी बदरा की छाई छाई रे घटा      जब सनन पवन को लगा तीर      बादल को चीड़ निकला रे नीर      झरझर झरझर अब धार झरे      ओ धरती जल से मांग भरे....      नन्हीं-नन्हीं बूंदनियों की       खनन-खनन खन खंजरी      बजाती आई देखो भाई      बरखा दुल्हनिया.... ( भरत व्यास, वसंत देसाई, लता मंगेशकर--मन्ना डे, दो आँखें बारह हाथ ) 4. रात भी है कुछ भींगी-भींगी     चाँद भी है कुछ मद्धम-मद्धम    तुम आओ तो आँखें खोलें    सोई हुई पायल की छमछम ( साहिर लुधियानवी, जयदेव, लता, मुझे जीने दो ) 5. हरी-हरी वसुंधरा पे है नई-नई किरण    ये किसके बादलों की पालकी उड़ा रहा पवन    दिशायें देखो रंग भरीं    चमक रही उमंग भरीं    ये किसने फूल-फूल पे    किया सिंगार है    ये कौन चित्रकार है ( भरत व्यास, सतीश भाटिया, मुकेश, बूँद जो बन गई मोती ) 6. हमने देखी है इन आँखों की महकती खुशबू     हाथ से छूके इन्हें रिश्तों का इल्जाम न दो     सिर्फ एहसास है ये रूह से महसूस करो     प्यार को प्यार ही रहने दो कोई नाम न दो ( गुलज़ार, हेमंत कुमार, लता, खामोशी )  7. इस मोड़ से जाते हैं     कुछ सुस्त कदम रस्ते     कुछ तेज कदम राहें   पत्थर की हवेली से    शीशों के घरौंदों में   तिनकों के नशेमन तक   इस मोड़ से जाते हैं ( गुलज़ार, राहुल देव बर्मन, लता, आँधी )  8. तुम आ गये हो नूर आ गया है    नहीं तो चिरागों से लौ जा रही थी ( ....वही...)  9. मैंने तेरे लिए ही     सात रंग के सपने चुनें    सपने सुरीले सपने    कुछ हंसते कुछ ग़म के    तेरी आँखों के साये चुराये    रसीली यादों ने ( गुलज़ार, सलिल चौधरी, मुकेश, आनंद )  10. ऐसी भी बातें होतीं हैं       कुछ दिल ने कहा       कुछ भी नहीं.. ( कैफ़ी आज़मी, हेमंत कुमार, लता, अनुपमा ) 11. ज्योति कलश छलके       भये गुलाबी, लाल, सुनहरे       रंग दल बादल के.... ( शैलेन्द्र, सलिल चौधरी, मन्ना डे--लता, दो बीघा जमीन )

Most of the answersI read are from old movies, so I am focusing on a couple of new ones from one of the best lyricist of our times."Irshad Kamil" One from Nadaan Parindey (Rock star): Kaaga re kaaga re mori itni araj tose [kaaga=crow]Chun chun khaaiyo maansKaaga re kaaga re mori itni araj toseChun chun khaaiyo maans Arajiya re khaaiyo na tu naina more [Araj= Request]Khaaiyon na tu naina mohePiya ke milan ki aasKhaaiyon na tu naina moreKhaaiyon na tu naina mohePiya ke milan ki aas Such a beautiful thought! The lines aptly portray his desperation and his love to see her one last time. Watching her is the only thing that matters to him. As per information provided by Chandrahaas this part of the lyrics comes from a sufi couplet by Baba Farid. Irshad Kamil adapted it beautifully. Another from Maahi Ve (Highway) : Yeh jeena bhi, na jeena bhiHai dono ka tumse hi vaastaO.. main hi to hoon tera pataaHai doosra naa koi raastaAaye mujh tak woh tumko jo ho dhoondhtaMeri khaamoshiyon mein hai tu boltaYeh jeena bhi, naa jeena bhiJo bhi hua hai, woh tumse hua... He feels he owes his life to her and is never going to leave her. His love and his passion to always be with her are conveyed perfectly through these lines. Edit: Had to include this gem as well Tum tak (Raanjhana):Naino ki dhaak le jaNaino ki naiyyaPatwaar tu hai meriTu khevaiyyaJaana hai paar tereTu hi bhanwar haiPahunchegi paar kaiseNaazuk si naiyya Take a bow Irshad Kamil PS: Please mention the lyricist who wrote those lines because in my opinion he deserves as much credit as the music director and singer.

"Duniya banane wale ,kya tere man me samaikaahe ko duniya banai..."Lyricist : Hasrat JaipuriAlbum  : Teesri kasamSinger  :  MukeshOne of it's paragraph "Tu bhi to tadpa hoga man ko banakar,toofan ye pyar ka man me chhupa karKoi chhavi to hogi ankho me teri,aansu bhi chhalke honge palko se tereBol kya sujhi tujhko,kahe ko preet jagaiKahe ko duniya banai..." English translation of this would be somewhat like : Creator of this world what (whims)were on your mind,why did you create it at allYou too would have suffered after creating mindafter hiding in it the storm of love,You too would have had some image/inspiration in your eyes and so you too would have cried after creating it...Tell what were you thinking after all why did you then create affection; Why (oh why)  did you create this world....' It's not like the usual irksome romantic songs and yet is about love; in a very non- clićhed manner and that is what makes it stand out from the rest. So many songs that come to mind are already in the thread. I run a blog that translates some of the most beautiful lyrics to English, please feel free to leave your feedback on https://bollywoodtarjuma.wordpress.com/Two songs that I adore and translated in my own way are here.1. Yeh Hausla – Dor by Mir Ali Husain Full information with lyrics on this page:https://bollywoodtarjuma.wordpress.com/2016/06/04/yeh-hausla-dor/My translation:This courage won’t bend,This yearning won’t end.What if the riverbank is far,what if its approach is foggy,what if my heart is lonelythis resolve won’t bend,this desire won’t end. If a path is paved with thorns,we will take the blood-soaked walk.Twilight may shroud the sun,but night will be broken by the dawn.This season shall pass,a morning will arrive,and courage will colour the tomorrows.Until then,this resolve won’t bend,this desire won’t end. If we are blessed,we shall have a shade under the scorching sun,We only plea to God,that our destination embraces us,when the journey is done.Until our spirit rebirths hundred times over, until consent is paramount,until every love lives forever,this resolve won’t bend,this desire won’t end.  2. Abhi mujh mein kahi – Agneepath by Amitabh BhattacharyaFull information with lyrics on this page:https://bollywoodtarjuma.wordpress.com/2016/06/02/abhi-mujh-mein-kahi-agneepath/My translation: A bit of lifeis still left in me,I realize a new heartbeat,in this moment, in this breath.I witness it,and wish to touch it,kiss the happiness living in it,and cry the tears it sheds,and ask it,‘where were you lost till now’? When my sun- scorched body,was finally soothed by some shade,it lit up like the smileof a sulking child,cajoled with a treat. The respite of that moment,a balm on my eternal wounds.The empathy of this moment, of this breath,makes me ask it,‘where were you lost till now’? Just like a string- less kite,my life floated away,unware of a tomorrow,that may never even come.As I worry about future, a fresh promise calls out to me,piercing my unmoving thoughtsin this moment, this breath,and I wish to ask it,‘where were you lost till now’?  Do visit my blog or Facebook page @ https://www.facebook.com/Bollywoodtarjuma-Bollywood-Songs-Translated-1032029423538673/?ref=aymt_homepage_panel and leave your feedback. Will look forward to it!

"Mujhpe barsi jo teri nigaahen,meri saanson ne badli adaayein.Aise nainon ki baaton mein koi kyun na aaye?" Translation:  When you showered your gaze on me,my breaths changed their style (pace)Who wouldn't believe in everything these eyes tell you?  These lines from Tere Naina (My Name is Khan) have stayed with me since a past lover sang them in my honor. Not only do the lyrics beautifully portray how eyes can capture hearts in a heartbeat, I have never forgotten the way these made me feel.
